revision.text:
[[Image:MapSinaiWWI.jpg|thumb||Map showing the location of Bir el Magdhaba and Rafah in the [[Sinai Peninsula]].]] '''Magdhaba-Rafah''' and '''Maghdaba-Rafah''' were [[Battle honours of the British and Imperial Armies|battle honours]] awarded to units of the [[First Australian Imperial Force|Australian Imperial Force]] and the [[New Zealand Expeditionary Force]] that took part in the [[Battle of Magdhaba|Affair of Magdhaba]] or the [[Battle of Rafa|Action of Rafah]] during the winter of 1916–17 in the [[Sinai and Palestine Campaign|Sinai Campaign]] of the [[Great War]].<ref>Rodger, Alexander. ''Battle Honours of the British Empire and Commonwealth Land Forces''. Marlborough: The Crowood Press. p. 186</ref>
Australian units were awarded ''Magdhaba-Rafah'': *[[1st Light Horse Regiment]] *[[2nd Light Horse Regiment]] *[[3rd Light Horse Regiment]] *[[8th Light Horse Regiment]] *[[9th Light Horse Regiment]] *[[10th Light Horse Regiment]] *[[14th Light Horse Regiment]] *[[15th Light Horse Regiment]] *[[3rd Light Horse Regiment (Australia)|26th (Tasmanian Mounted Infantry) Light Horse Regiment]]<ref>Later the ''22nd'' (1921–30, 1933–42) and ''3rd (Tasmanian Mounted Infantry) Light Horse Regiment'' (1930–33). See [http://alh-research.tripod.com/Light_Horse/index.blog/1909532/tasmanian-mounted-infantry-1916/ 26th (Tasmanian Mounted Infantry) Australian Light Horse].</ref>
New Zealand units were awarded ''Maghdaba-Rafah'': *[[1st Mounted Rifles (Canterbury Yeomanry Cavalry)]] *[[Queen Alexandra's 2nd (Wellington West Coast) Mounted Rifles]] *[[3rd (Auckland) Mounted Rifles]] *[[4th (Waikato) Mounted Rifles]] *[[6th (Manawatu) Mounted Rifles]] *[[9th (Wellington East Coast) Mounted Rifles]] *[[10th (Nelson) Mounted Rifles]] *[[11th (North Auckland) Mounted Rifles]]
==Notes and references== {{reflist}}
